1: By the time he reached his home on the seventeenth floor, he was gasping for breath.
2: He also disliked the way people tried hard not to look at one another, staring at nothing.
3: But 7.30 in the morning was too early for visiting.
4: “Now she knows I live on seventeen,” he thought.
6: “I promised to visit Mrs. Ullman,” said his father, looking at his watch as he stepped out of the elevator.
7: “Hello, Martin,” she said, and laughed, and pushed the Stop button.
